question:
how to make a peppermint stripe

Choices:
A: Pour 1/2 ounce crème de cacao into a shooter glass. Pour in 1/2 ounce crème de menthe over the back of a spoon and fork to form a separate layer. Top with 1/2 ounce Irish cream liqueur in the same manner.
B: Pour 1/2 ounce crème de cacao into a shooter glass. Pour in 1/2 ounce crème de menthe over the back of a spoon to form a separate layer. Top with 1/2 ounce Irish cream liqueur in the same manner.
steps: First, identify the steps involved in making a peppermint stripe based on the description of the drink.
Review the choices presented to ensure that the method described matches the requirements to create the peppermint stripe.
Choice A mentions using both a spoon and a fork to pour the crème de menthe to form a separate layer, which is more complex.
Choice B mentions using only a spoon to pour the crème de menthe to form a separate layer, which is simpler and more typical for creating layered drinks.
Both choices involve the same initial step: pouring 1/2 ounce crème de cacao into a shooter glass.
Both choices involve the same final step: topping with 1/2 ounce Irish cream liqueur over the back of the spoon to form a separate layer.
Since the simpler method in Choice B matches the standard approach for creating layered drinks, Choice B is the correct answer.
